title: Why do we along the southeast coast have to pay high rates for hurricane and flood insurance when people that live in tornado alley or in the snow belt don\'t have to pay high premiums to cover the damage caused by heavy snow, ice and tornados?
text:
We've had a number of stories about the reasons behind the higher
costs of insurance along the east coast. But we concentrate here on
items that are of interest to Southeastern North Carolina and don't
have the staff to research insurance policies all over the country.
